channel.title: Getting an error when loading online client
channel.description:
I reinstalled it like twice(and restarted comp)and it still won't work [IMG]http://img442.imageshack.us/img442/2893/42574674wd3.png[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------- [code]Java Plug-in 1.6.0_02 Using JRE version 1.6.0_02 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM User home directory = C:\Documents and Settings\ ---------------------------------------------------- load: class AppletBot not found. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: AppletBot at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin.AppletViewer.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.runLoader(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.io.IOException: open HTTP connection failed. at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.getBytes(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) ... 10 more[/code] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[br][size=1]Posted on: July 18, 2007, 09:54:07 PM[/size][hr]its already posted.. .

item.title: Getting an error when loading online client

item.title: Getting an error when loading online client
item.dc:creator: @uu83r_pwn4g3 uu83r pwn4g3
item.description:
@uu83r_pwn4g3 wrote:

i have the same problem and ive worked on it for 20+ hours so far and figured out that the folowing dont help in anyway

1.using mozilla firefox,
2.un-installing and re-installing java,
3.un-installing and re-installing moparscape,
4.updating java to the latest version.
5.even if u restart your computer 2 and 3 still wont work

ive also found that java.exe,javac.exe,javaw.exe and so on in the “bin” folder of jre or jdk dont work,it flashes a message to you and then closes…ill tell you all if i ever find a way to fix it

Read full topic
